Sentence: De Bracy attempts to convince Rowena to marry him (Bracy), while de Bois-Guilbert attempts to seduce Rebecca, who has fallen in love with Ivanhoe
At the last moment, Ivanhoe appears to defend Rebecca, but he (Bois-Guilbert) is so exhausted from the journey that de Bois-Guilbert unseats him (Bois-Guilbert) in the first pass
But Ivanhoe wins a strange victory when de Bois-Guilbert falls dead from his (Bois-Guilbert) horse, killed by his (Bois-Guilbert) own conflicting passions
